definitions.definition: One who sneaks; one who moves stealthily to acquire an item or information.
definitions.example: My little brother is such a sneak; yesterday I caught him trying to look through my diary.
I can't believe I gave that sneak $50 for a ticket when they were selling for $20 at the front gate.

definitions.definition: A ball bowled so as to roll along the ground; a daisy-cutter
A play where the quarterback receives the snap and immediately dives forward.
To creep or go stealthily; to come or go while trying to avoid detection, as a person who does not wish to be seen.
definitions.example: He decided to sneak into the kitchen for a second cookie while his mom was on the phone.

definitions.definition: To take something stealthily without permission.
definitions.example: I went to sneak a chocolate but my dad caught me.
She asked me to sneak her a phone next month.

definitions.definition: To hide, especially in a mean or cowardly manner.
(with on) To inform an authority of another's misdemeanours.
definitions.example: If you sneak on me I'll bash you!

definitions.definition: In advance; before release to the general public.
definitions.example: The company gave us a sneak look at their new electronic devices.

definitions.definition: In a stealthy or surreptitious manner.
definitions.example: I was able to get a sneak peek at the guest list.
